text: Kurt Eisner (14 May 1867 in Berlin – 21 February 1919 in Munich)"Kurt Eisner - Encyclopaedia Britannica" (biography), Encyclopædia Britannica, 2006, Britannica.com webpage: Britannica-KurtEisner. was a Bavarian politician and journalist. As a German socialist journalist and statesman, he organized the Socialist Revolution that took over the Wittelsbach monarchy in Bavaria in November 1918. He is used as an example of charismatic authority by Max Weber. Eisner was of Jewish descent. == References == Category:1867 births Category:1919 deaths Category:Assassinated German politicians Category:German journalists Category:Jewish German politicians Category:Jewish German writers Category:Ministers-President of Bavaria Category:Murders by firearm in Germany Category:Politicians from Berlin Category:Weimar Republic politicians Category:Writers from Berlin
title: Kurt Eisner
